fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32995].
  {panel}

The current options available are as follows:
!dt.png!

This creates 2 OpenLDAP options where one of it states that Read-Only. 

Probably a more significant name can be used, such as:
* Apple Open Directory (Read-Only support)
* FedoraDS Posix Schema (Read-Only support)
* OpenLDAP
* OpenLDAP Posix Schema (Read-Only support)
* Generic Posix/RCF2307 Directory (Read-Only support)
fields.summary: Improve the Directory Type options in LDAP User Directory Configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32994].
  {panel}

Hi All,

Support found a few cases that the customer is using the parameter mentioned in this page - ['Tuning databse connection'|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Tuning+Database+Connections ] in their JIRA < 5.1 version. This is known to break the Indexing in JIRA without any obvious error, as mentioned in this KB:

[Indexing fails due to unsupported database configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+re-indexing+fails+due+to+unsupported+database+configuration]

This is causing confusion among the customer  as they thought this should be working.

I would suggest to have a warning message to make this a bit clearer for everyone.

(!) Note that this parameter only compatible with JIRA 5.1 and above and do not use this parameter for JIRA prior 5.1 version

.. Or something like that
fields.summary: Add a warning message on 'Tuning databse connection' page
Expose user session info though API
Ability to reposition comment field
JIRA project id embeded in text is case sensitive.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32990].
  {panel}

Situation:
All managerial employees need to be added as watchers to all issues marked as Blocker.

Solution:
1) Create a role called "Managers".
2) Ensure the priority includes "Blocker".
3) Edit the "Create" transition of the appropriate workflow.
4) Add a new post-function "Add Watcher".
5) Choose user/role/group.
6) Choose to filter based on priority, and choose "Blocker".
7) Publish Workflow Draft.
fields.summary: Workflow Post-Function that sets a role as Watcher based on priority
emails containing updates to issue descriptions show the diff not merely the new and old
Customize attachment path

fields.description:
As per described on JRA-31882, I've performed the same tests using dash ('-') instead of underscore ('\_'), and the results were the same when using "test-1234". 
|1. summary ~ 'test-1234' | Full match with dash WORKS.|
|2. summary ~ 'test-123' | Partial match with dash FAILS.|
|3. summary ~ 'test-123*' | Partial match with dash and wildcard WORKS.|
|4. summary ~ 'test-' | Partial match with no trailing characters after the dash returns many issues which do not contain an dash, one that does "Test Test - Test Test", but not the one we want. FAILS.|
|5. summary ~ 'test-*' | Partial match with a wildcard WORKS.|
|6. summary ~ 'est-1234' | Partial match with missing leading characters. FAILS.|
|7. summary ~ 'est' | Partial match with missing leading characters and no dash. FAILS.|
|8. summary ~ '*est' | Leading wildcards are prohibited by the system.|

However, upon testing a bit further, it _*seems*_ JIRA is not being able to find results when searching using wildcard and dash twice in a row, if the first two parts only contain letters (e.g.: "TEST-ABCD-JI*").

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create an issue with the summary "*TEST-ABCD-JIRA*" and one "*TEST-ABC1D-JIRA*";
# Open the JQL;
# Search for
bq. Summary ~ "TEST-ABCD-JI*"
and
bq. Summary ~ "TEST-ABC1D-JI*"

h3. Expected Results:
When searching for {{Summary ~ "TEST-ABCD-JI*"}}, JIRA would find the issue with summary "*TEST-ABCD-JIRA*"; and when searching for {{"TEST-ABC1D-JI*"}} JIRA would find "*TEST-ABC1D-JIRA*".

h3. Actual Results:
When searching for {{Summary ~ "TEST-ABCD-JI*"}}, JIRA does not find the issue with summary "*TEST-ABCD-JIRA*"; but when searching for {{"TEST-ABC1D-JI*"}} JIRA finds "*TEST-ABC1D-JIRA*".

*Notes:* 
This was tested in JIRA 5.2.11 using 'Other' as the Indexing Language.
There are two problems described in this report. Inconsistent behavior with contains operator when searching using the dash character (which may be covered in JRA-31882 if updated), and the search not finding results if having multiple dashes and only characters.
fields.summary: JQL search shows incorrect results when search using dash

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32984].
  {panel}

As documented on the following documentation:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/User+failed+to+logon+JIRA+when+it+had+limitation+on+the+logon+workstation+from+Active+directory

When there is a [logon workstation policy|http://4sysops.com/archives/deny-and-allow-workstation-logons-with-group-policy/] applied to the AD, the user must provide the access the following areas in order for the user to authenticate successfully.

# The client laptop.
# The proxy server if you got.
# The JIRA server.
# The Domain Controller.

But there are cases where giving access to the domain controller is not possible, therefore customer has requested for us to exclude the domain controller for authenticating purposes.

Actual quote from customer:
{quote}
We expect Jira to ask AD to log on to the Jira server if this is configured as one of the workstations the user is allowed to log on to in the domain (or even to any other authorized workstation).
{quote}
fields.summary: Remove Requirement to Give Access to Domain Controller in the case of AD with Logon Workstation Policy
Minimal length of project name not validated on project edit
List down existing files in the edit or transition screen
Add project category in the statistic type of pie chart

fields.description:
I'm running Chrome on a 1920x1080 display and looking at a Jira project summary page in Jira 6.0 results in the activity stream running off the bottom of the page.
To reproduce:
# Open https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA
# Reduce the browser width to 960px or less
# The activity stream will be place to the bottom of the screen on top of the footer

I'm attaching a screengrab of the issue
fields.summary: Jira 6 project summary screen doesn't degrade gracefully in small browser windows
JSU - Transitions Summary tab may have stopped working
Order of sub-tasks should reflect default GreenHopper Rank if available.
Button Text Color has an extra comma
Word Stemming Documentation
Request all labels with REST API
The "gg" shortcut should work with Caps Lock activated
Automatically reject all sub-tasks if parent task is rejected.
Ability to search multiple old issue keys
Add option to the 2 Dimensional Gadget for manipulating labels.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32965].
  {panel}

I would like to know if there is an archival policy in JIRA.

What I need is :
- Archive old projects.
- Archive old issues in a project, e.g. I have 10,000 issues and growing fast. I want to archive all issues closed before 2011. 

Regards,
Vijay
fields.summary: Archival policy in JIRA
Rich Text formatting in JIRA
List of dashboards gets cut off

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32962].
  {panel}

We have a long-running project, where some of the components are no longer relevant (e.g. they were archived, merged, or discarded).
However, we prefer not to delete these components, since we might still need to relate to their corresponding issues.
Hence, we would like to have a way to mark such components as 'obsolete'. This means that:
- they won't be available in the 'Components' field when creating an issue (perhaps also when updating an existing issue).
- they will be available when filtering.
- they will appear separately (or struck-through) in the Components tab of the project.
fields.summary: Provide a way to mark Components as Obsolete

fields.description:
I created a new project. After creating I went to the project screen to change the workflow. When I select the Workflows tab I just get a spinning disk.
The same happens when I do this with an existing project.

I can see all the workflows (3) from the Administration/Workflows screen.

We updated from 5.0.5 to 5.2.11 last week.

I created this issue here because when I tried to do it via the Support Request screen it told me to log in as administrator when I tried to submit. But I was an adminstrator
fields.summary: Cannot see available workflows when editing a projects workflow
As an admin, I'd like to sort issues base on the Rank without having GreenHopper
Remove default search filters
Replace usage of common.concepts.popular⁠ for displaying the popular dashboards label so popular can be in plural

fields.description:
See attached screenshot where project was changed from Kudos to Office.

Specifically there's still a "Kudos Summary" label.

!screenshot-1.jpg!
fields.summary: Changing project type doesn't update labels properly when changing project.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32953].
  {panel}

When an anonymous user is creating a ticket and tries to attach a file to it, it gets the following error message:
_Cannot attach file: Unknown server error (404)._

The network response message is the following:
_No project could be found with id '10103'._

This happens because in the project permissions, although the group 'Anyone' has permissions to 'Create Issues' and 'Add Attachments', it does not have permissions to 'Browse Projects'.

Unless there is a workaround, it seems that this functionality to add attachments anonymously is missing.
fields.summary: Users cannot attach a file while creating a ticket unless they have 'Browse Projects' permissions
Re-order the create issue buttons on the project screen

BulkEditUserGroups autocomplete user field does not work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32948].
  {panel}

Currently we cannot use nested groups between Internal and External groups.
We have a bug already created ([JRA-24671|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24671]) for this, but there nothing mentioning this restriction in the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Nested+Groups]

It would avoid a lot of issues if this information was explicit there
* [Managing Nested Groups|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Nested+Groups]
fields.summary: Update 'Managing Nested Groups' page regarding Internal vs External groups
Option to set a default for 'Send mail' option during bulk issue operations
Component Sorting when Swapping

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32943].
  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions lists exclusions under the section:
"People who have the JIRA Administrators permission (and not the JIRA System Administrators permission) cannot do the following"

However, the list of exclusions does not mention plugin installations.

I have confirmed that "JIRA Administrators" permission is insufficient to upload a plugin, you require "JIRA System Administrators" permission.  

I recommend adding this exclusion to the list to make it clear JIRA Admins will not have enough permission to install a plugin.
fields.summary: Please update documentation - JIRA Admin permission insufficient to install plugins

fields.description:
Recently I have tried to upgrade the Jira instance (on testing server).
We use mysql as a database.

before: Jira v5.2.4#845-sha1:c9f4cc4
after: Jira v6.0-rc1#6085-sha1:c75e730

During the upgrade, data migration failed with the exception in the ticket description.

{code}
Exception thrown during upgrade: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:UPDATE userassociation SET  SOURCE_NAME = ?  WHERE SINK_NODE_ID=? AND SINK_NODE_ENTITY=? AND ASSOCIATION_TYPE=? (Duplicate entry 'przemyslaw.marcinows-24682-Issue-WatchIssue' for key 'PRIMARY')
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:UPDATE userassociation SET  SOURCE_NAME = ?  WHERE SINK_NODE_ID=? AND SINK_NODE_ENTITY=? AND ASSOCIATION_TYPE=? (Duplicate entry 'przemyslaw.marcinows-24682-Issue-WatchIssue' for key 'PRIMARY')
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.bulkUpdateByAnd(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:694)
	at com.atlassian.jira.entity.Update$WhereContext.execute(Update.java:136)
	at com.atlassian.jira.entity.EntityEngineImpl.execute(EntityEngineImpl.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build6039$AssociationVisitor.lowercaseThisRow(UpgradeTask_Build6039.java:250)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build6039$AssociationVisitor.visit(UpgradeTask_Build6039.java:218)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build6039$AssociationVisitor.visit(UpgradeTask_Build6039.java:193)
	at com.atlassian.jira.entity.SelectQueryImpl$ExecutionContextImpl$3.consume(SelectQueryImpl.java:147)
	at com.atlassian.jira.entity.SelectQueryImpl$ExecutionContextImpl.consumeWith(SelectQueryImpl.java:129)
	at com.atlassian.jira.entity.SelectQueryImpl$ExecutionContextImpl.visitWith(SelectQueryImpl.java:142)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build6039.updateNamesToLowercase(UpgradeTask_Build6039.java:174)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build6039.updateSimpleColumn(UpgradeTask_Build6039.java:144)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build6039.doUpgrade(UpgradeTask_Build6039.java:95)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgradeTaskSuccess(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:673)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.runUpgradeTasks(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:526)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgrade(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:456)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgradeIfNeeded(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:399)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgradeIfNeededAndAllowed(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:333)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeLauncher.checkIfUpgradeNeeded(UpgradeLauncher.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeLauncher.start(UpgradeLauncher.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher$3.run(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:117)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrEnqueue(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:315)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrWhenDatabaseActivated(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:209)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.postDbLaunch(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.access$100(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:30)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher$1.run(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.devspeed.JiraDevSpeedTimer.run(JiraDevSpeedTimer.java:33)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.start(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:64)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.contextInitialized(LauncherContextListener.java:54)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:4791)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.startInternal(StandardContext.java:5285)
	at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase.start(LifecycleBase.java:150)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$StartChild.call(ContainerBase.java:1559)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$StartChild.call(ContainerBase.java:1549)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:UPDATE userassociation SET  SOURCE_NAME = ?  WHERE SINK_NODE_ID=? AND SINK_NODE_ENTITY=? AND ASSOCIATION_TYPE=? (Duplicate entry 'przemyslaw.marcinows-24682-Issue-WatchIssue' for key 'PRIMARY')
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.executeUpdate(SQLProcessor.java:650)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.bulkUpdateByAnd(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:685)
	... 37 more
{code}

I had to 
{code}
ALTER TABLE jira.userassociation DROP PRIMARY KEY;
{code}

and then upgrade proceeded to the sucessful end.

{code}
SELECT COUNT(*), SOURCE_NAME, SINK_NODE_ID FROM jira.userassociation
   GROUP BY SOURCE_NAME, SINK_NODE_ID
   HAVING COUNT(*)>1;
{code}
Results with hundreds of duplicated rows which prevents me from recreating primary key back again.
fields.summary: Jira 6.0rc1 data migration bug

fields.description:
If you access JIRA with the wrong url it tells you that and gives you the options of either hiding the message or updating the base url.

If you click the "Update the base url" link, the base url WILL BE CHANGED to that, WITHOUT asking you for admin credentials.
fields.summary: JIRA changes base url without asking for admin authentication
Change scheme configurations to use 'Multi Select' instead of 'Select List'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32939].
  {panel}

JIRA already had the Time Tracking Report  which gives the progress % of a project against the current estimate. 

It takes into account the time spent and the remaining time on issue to give a percentage complete.

However the report must be filtered to a given version of a single project, and then can't be filtered further by user. 

I'd find it really valuable if my developers can see their own progress % against issues assigned to them.
fields.summary: Time Tracking Report should also show progress for individual users and not just for projects
Change 'Inactive' message to the front of the username instead of the back
Allow filtering of sub-task by parent issue in Issue Navigator

The "Add to developers group" option when creating a user in JOD is redundant

fields.description:
Issue Collector plug-in is working well in the browsers chrome and Firefox. But in internet explorer 9.0,the "submit button" and "close button" are invisible in IE9.0. 

When I mouse over on those buttons they are blinked.(shown). But when I mouse out from that, again it got disappeared.

The code snippet of mine is something like this.

jQuery.ajax({
url: "https://xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",
type: "get",
cache: true,
dataType: "script",

...........

 

Please provide me a solution for this problem.

Thanks,

Senthil.
fields.summary: Jira Issue Collector : The "submit" button and "close" buttons are not visible when feedback dialog loads

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32931].
  {panel}

There are several reports from customers regarding the JIRA Timesheet reports no longer working after the plugin upgrade to version 2.3.15.

The developer of the plugin already recognized this version and 2.3.16 as problematic ones and it seems it is fixed in the next release:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/164724/time-sheet-gadget-stopped-working-last-week?page=1#164761

It would be good to update the plugin or at least roll back to the previous version 2.3.14 that was working before.

Thanks!
Clarissa.
fields.summary: Rollback Timesheet plugin version to 2.3.14

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32930].
  {panel}

Hello there,

I know that this is an expected behaviour but I believe that the change of "JIRA Admin" option from cog menu to "System" may confuse some users. Note that other application continue to have their own menus (Confluence have Confluence Admin, Bamboo have Bamboo Admin, etc).

I say this just because 
"System" option could let some customers to think that JIRA Admin is missing, while "System" could mean the whole system itself, not only JIRA options.

Please check the availability to change "System" to "JIRA Admin".
fields.summary: Change "System" option on administration menu to "JIRA Admin"
Remove dependency on applinks-core 2.5.12 from JIRA ondemand

fields.description:
reproduce: in FF23.0a search for issues and then click on column headers.
expected: table is sorted by the column. 
actual: nothing happens.
This bug doesn't appear if firebug is installed and active on the browser.
fields.summary: column sorting in search results doesn't work in firefox 23.0a
Latest API doc returns 403

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32922].
  {panel}

h3. Summary:
JIRA users can [customize|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Customising+your+Issue+Navigator] their issue navigator column and this customization suppress the [default configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+the+Default+Issue+Navigator].

h3. The problem:
Sometimes this behavior can cause confusion and the administration doesn't have an option to reset this setting.

h3. Proposed fix:
Create an option inside JIRA administration section where the administrator can set issue navigator's columns to the default globally and per user.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I'd like to be able to reset user's custom issue navigator columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32921].
  {panel}

This is a re-open for JRA-31384 (I can't vote on it as it's closed).

The JQL query language lacks the possibility to return a limited number of issues from a search, compare with SQL LIMIT or TOP statements.

This would be very valuable when you want to get e.g. the 10 highest ranked stories.

Here's our use case:

* We have one project that represents a global list of wishes (issues). Issues are created by multiple departments, and issues that are cross-department are tagged as such.
* Each department has a separate rapid board to let them prioritize their issues as they see fit (using a department specific rank field).
* We have a global rapid board that is used to rank all department issues in a global order. Ideally this board would only show the top N issues from each department to keep the global list of reasonable length. This is where having a limit would be helpful.
fields.summary: JQL LIMIT support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32920].
  {panel}

Due Dates are ambiguous. It should capture the time based on the user's profile timezone settings.

Currently, it stores without time value.

Compare vs. the Created Date on a server running on UTC time:
{code}
+---------------------+---------------------+
| created             | duedate             |
+---------------------+---------------------+
| 2013-05-03 21:21:35 | 2013-05-03 00:00:00 | 
+---------------------+---------------------+
{code}

This can lead to inconsistent rendering of the *duedate*, especially if the server is on UTC time, and users are scattered around the world. 

Example:

On the issue view, it'll show me one date, but when using the jiraissues macro, it shows a date behind.
fields.summary: Add timezone offset to due date
add @comment feature for GROUPS
Change history search based on days returns different results depending on your time zone...
Provide ability to disable an issue type in an issue scheme
If the username has capital letters in the incoming mail handler a non-JIRA users email address isn't recorded
"Where's my field?" does not appear in "More" menu on View Issue page

fields.description:
Import xml from 4.2.x Jira instance
File parses to 3% and then fails with an ambiguous nullpointerexception.
{code}

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
Add a Fix Version to an issue
Rename the Version in that issue's project
Verify the History Tab

*Expected behaviour*
JIRA should display something like
{noformat}
User made changes - Today
Fix Version/s                                 Version renamed
{noformat}

*Actual Behaviour*
JIRA displays something like
{noformat}
User made changes - Today
Fix Version/s                                 Original Version name
{noformat}

This happens for other fields as well such as status.
fields.summary: Renamed fields are not replicated into the History tab in Issue View

fields.description:
This improvement request was discovered when comparing JIRA 5.0.5 and the latest version of JIRA 5.2.11. Essentially when you are editing the Description field for a Version it was previously possible to hit Enter and have the Description of the Version be saved. In the latest version of JIRA 5.2.11 it is no longer possible to hit Enter to save the Description - you must use the mouse to select Update. 

Note that when you are first creating a Version you do have the option of hitting enter while in the Description field and it will save the new Version. 

Screenshot attached is from JIRA 5.0.5.
fields.summary: Save Version (when editing) Using Enter vs. Update Field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32897].
  {panel}

This page:

https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Database+Schema

Does not contain enough information on all the tables in the database for our users. For example a user would like to have a description for the 'searchrequest' table. 

Could this be added for each table?
fields.summary: Improve database schema documentation
Add flag emoticons
Bundle the update of JIRA Connector plugin For JIRA in OnDemand OD-13

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32893].
  {panel}

There is the ability to transition a Parent issue in the Sub Issue, this functionality should be replicated to Linked Issues.

There are plugins that get around this limitation, but they are not available for the OnDemand service.  Aside from this, Linked Issues appears to be a core piece of functionality in Jira, therefore being able to apply this transition seems logical.

For Example:

Support-1 is relates by Issue-2, Issue-3, Issue-4.  I would expect to add a Condition on the Moving to "Retest" on Support-1 that will not allow it to move unless all Issues Linked with the "relates to" link are at "Resolved" or "Closed".  I then add a "Transition Linked Issue" Post Function to the Workflow of Issue-2,3,4 that will fire that Transition.

The use case is that the Support teams who are also using the Jira system will get a notification that they need to verify that the support ticket can be closed based on the new work.

We do have various other use-cases for this same functionality, in terms of getting round the fixed hierarchy of issue types (e.g. creating an Issue-type that groups "Story" issues together under an "Epic" in Greenhopper).
fields.summary: Post Function to Transition linked issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32892].
  {panel}

I don't know if you already have a matching feature to my request but from all the gadgets I've installed i couldn't find a satisfying one to show a visual easy to read easy to make road-map or life-cycle preview, what i am looking to achieve is to be able top give a snap shot of any project i choose at any time to any of my clients,that way they will always be in the loop and wont bother me with questions all day long.
can you direct me to the right tool or tell me are you planing on developing one?

( I dont need to build gants, just present them in a visual way, no risk mangement or anything like it just dates and names an time scale with green for progressing well and red for not and yellow for on-hold, somthing like that
Thanks in advance
Ronny
fields.summary: Better visual Road map - product life-cycle - I've attached a good example

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32891].
  {panel}

Hi Team,

Please update this JIRA doc:
* [Running JIRA over SSL or HTTPS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS]

Due to our [Atlssian support offering|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Support/Atlassian+Support+Offerings] policy, SSL certificate is not in our support scope.
{quote}
Third-Party Product Integration
Atlassian products interface with a variety of technologies. Front-end solutions like Web Servers (eg Apache HTTP Server), load balancers, single sign-on solutions, SSL certificates and LDAP repositories add functionality that is often critical to functioning of our products.
{quote}

It will be much clear for users and support engineers if we put the note/warning box like in the following doc:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache+using+SSL
!example.PNG|thumbnail!

Best Regards
fields.summary: Update the JIRA documentaion-"Running JIRA over SSL or HTTPS"
Option to Include Incoming Mail as Attachment on the Issue

fields.description:
While doing some DB tests, I noticed in the mysql logs that "select 1" validation queries were still being fired on each query, contrary to the documentation on [Tuning Database Connections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Tuning+Database+Connections].

I didn't go away until I explicitly declared it false like so:

{code}
<pool-test-on-borrow>false</pool-test-on-borrow>
<pool-test-on-return>false</pool-test-on-return>
{code}

Other References:
* http://royontechnology.blogspot.com/2009/02/gotchas-with-dbcp.html
fields.summary: MySQL's dbconfig.xml testOnBorrow does not default to false; need to set explicity

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32881].
  {panel}

A user was trying to figure out if a user with the global permission of 'administrator' could install plugins. During testing I established they could not. However reading the documentation here:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions#ManagingGlobalPermissions-sysadmin

It isn't listed under: 

'About 'JIRA System Administrators' and 'JIRA Administrators' 

under the 

'People who have the JIRA Administrators permission (and not the JIRA System Administrators permission) cannot do the following:'

Could we add a note to make it clear that they cannot install plugins?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Update documentation to make clear administrators cannot install plugins
Map categories as JIRA components/labels when importing issues from Redmine
Creating issues with the "Create another" checkbox checked, hours should be blank until users fill it
Add Create step to the Text view
Improve usability of field configuration and custom field screens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32874].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Filtering for active and inactive users has been available in Atlassian Cloud for some time.

Unfortunately, JIRA Server does not share the same user management system and we have not been able to implement this feature in JIRA Server; however we will continue to consider it for the future.

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Add a filter option in the User Browser to filter specifically for inactive users
fields.summary: User Browser Filter for Inactive users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32873].
  {panel}

We generally don't mind inline edit for most fields but it does become distracting for certain fields. In our case, this is usually any multiline text field such as Description or other custom field we've generated. It would be great if we could activate inline edit for this fields only when the Edit icon is clicked. I am picturing an option like so:

Default: Inline Edit enabled for all fields.
Edit Icon: List of fields for which Inline Edit is activated only when Edit Icon is clicked
Disabled: List of field for which Inline Edit is disabled.

--
Per user option (JRA-29091) would be nice but is not required for our needs.
fields.summary: Ability to assign inline edit preference/option per field
Set expiration days on password link

fields.description:
When creating an issue in the Create Issue Screen, the screen does not close. This problem happens when clicking on the *create an issue* link from Project Summary.

*Step to reproduce the problem:*
# Create a new Project, and let's call it *Project A*.
# Click on the *"create an issue"* link at {{Project Summary -> Issues (tab)}}. Please see 
!Project Summary.JPG|thumbnail!
# Fill up the values in Create Issue Screen and click on the *Create* button. However, the screen does not close and still allow user to create another issue. If a user keeps clicking on the *Create* button, it will contain duplicate issues. Please see 
!duplicate issue created.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Creating a new issue in the Create Issue Screen does not close the screen
Keep JIRA header visible at all times
To add a notification email and reminder when a due date is passing for an issue
Update JIRA 4.4 Supported Platforms page to show correct PostgreSQL versions
Ability to restrict the number of components on the default Components field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32861].
  {panel}

Startup log for LDAP looks something like:

{code}CONNECTOR                                     : LDAP server
          Implementing Class                            : com.atlassian.crowd.directory.OpenLDAP
          Allowed Operations                            : UPDATE_GROUP_ATTRIBUTE,UPDATE_USER_ATTRIBUTE
          Encryption Type                               : sha
          Active                                        : true
          Attributes                                    : 
               autoAddGroups                                 : 
               com.atlassian.crowd.directory.sync.currentstartsynctime : 
               com.atlassian.crowd.directory.sync.issynchronising : false
               com.atlassian.crowd.directory.sync.lastdurationms : 64
               com.atlassian.crowd.directory.sync.laststartsynctime : 1367327244465
               crowd.sync.incremental.enabled                : true
               directory.cache.synchronise.interval          : 3600
               ldap.basedn                                   : o=more
               ldap.connection.timeout                       : 10000
               ldap.group.description                        : description
               ldap.group.dn                                 : 
               ldap.group.filter                             : (objectclass=groupOfNames)
               ldap.group.name                               : cn
               ldap.group.objectclass                        : groupOfNames
               ldap.group.usernames                          : member
               ldap.local.groups                             : false
               ldap.nestedgroups.disabled                    : true
               ldap.pagedresults                             : false
               ldap.pagedresults.size                        : 1000
               ldap.password                                 : xxxxxx
               ldap.pool.initsize                            : 
               ldap.pool.maxsize                             : 
               ldap.pool.prefsize                            : 
               ldap.pool.timeout                             : 0
               ldap.propogate.changes                        : false
               ldap.read.timeout                             : 120000
               ldap.referral                                 : true
               ldap.relaxed.dn.standardisation               : false
               ldap.roles.disabled                           : true
               ldap.search.timelimit                         : 60000
               ldap.secure                                   : true
               ldap.url                                      : ldaps://example.com:636
               ldap.user.displayname                         : fullName
               ldap.user.dn                                  : 
               ldap.user.email                               : mail
               ldap.user.encryption                          : sha
               ldap.user.filter                              : (&(objectclass=inetOrgPerson)(cn=*)(!(sn=admin)))
               ldap.user.firstname                           : givenName
               ldap.user.group                               : groupMembership
               ldap.user.lastname                            : sn
               ldap.user.objectclass                         : inetorgperson
               ldap.user.password                            : xxxxxx
               ldap.user.username                            : cn
               ldap.user.username.rdn                        : cn
               ldap.userdn                                   : cn=stuff,o=more
               ldap.usermembership.use                       : true
               ldap.usermembership.use.for.groups            : false{code}

But the messages in the logs always use the directory id:

{code}2013-04-30 07:10:58,407 QuartzWorker-0 INFO ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] synchronisation for directory [ 10000 ] starting
2013-04-30 07:10:58,473 QuartzWorker-1 INFO      [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] synchronisation for directory [ 10100 ] starting{code}

This makes troubleshooting directory issues much more difficult. We should display the directory ID in the startup logs.
fields.summary: Startup log should provide ID of all user directories
SMS Notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32859].
  {panel}

Currently there are plenty of export options, e.g. in the Issue Navigator, or the Issue View screen.

It would be useful to have the same export feature at the project level. Example use cases:
- export *Project Overview > Issues* for an at-a-glance report of the project state
- export report results under *Project Overview > Reports*
fields.summary: Ability to export Project Overview and Project Reports
Component assignee by priority

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32857].
  {panel}

When the remote issue copy is failing due to the ["CertificateTooOldException when Configuring Trusted Communication"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/CertificateTooOldException+when+Configuring+Trusted+Communication], it throws an ugly error message on the browser:

{code}
Remote copy fails: Unrecognized field "errorMessages"

Cause:
com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.EntityConversionException: org.codehaus.jackson.map.exc.UnrecognizedPropertyException: Unrecognized field "errorMessages" (Class com.atlassian.cpji.rest.model.ErrorBean), not marked as ignorable at [Source: org.apache.commons.httpclient.AutoCloseInputStream@61d8ecd8; line: 1, column: 19] (through reference chain: com.atlassian.cpji.rest.model.ErrorBean["errorMessages"])
Stack Trace: [hide]
com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.EntityConversionException: org.codehaus.jackson.map.exc.UnrecognizedPropertyException: Unrecognized field "errorMessages" (Class com.atlassian.cpji.rest.model.ErrorBean), not marked as ignorable
at [Source: org.apache.commons.httpclient.AutoCloseInputStream@61d8ecd8; line: 1, column: 19] (through reference chain: com.atlassian.cpji.rest.model.ErrorBean["errorMessages"])
at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.jersey.JerseyResponse.getEntity(JerseyResponse.java:50)
at com.atlassian.cpji.components.remote.AbstractJsonResponseHandler.handle(AbstractJsonResponseHandler.java:43)stack trace when remote
at com.atlassian.cpji.components.remote.RemoteJiraProxy$5.handle(RemoteJiraProxy.java:176)
at com.atlassian.cpji.components.remote.RemoteJiraProxy$5.handle(RemoteJiraProxy.java:163)
{code}

I would be great to improve the error message to something like "Remote copy fails: Unrecognized field "errorMessages" - don't panic"
fields.summary: Improve the error thrown when issue copy fails

fields.description: When you have a Select List custom field with html values on the options (e.g. Bug), it displays correctly in the issue view !IssueView.jpg|thumbnail! but not in the Issue Navigator. !IssueNav.jpg|thumbnail! Also, if you try to filter using the field, you get an error 'The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.' *Steps to reproduce* Create a Select List custom field Add options like Bug Go to the Issue Navigator and filter using the field just created *Expected behaviour* Values on the field should display with the like it's displayed on the Issue View screen Filter should work using the field *Actual behaviour* Values are shown incorrectly (e.g. Bug! value="10100"> Bug) Error is returned when trying to filter using the field ("The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.")
fields.summary: Custom Field Select option values with HTML text do not work correctly in Issue navigator

fields.description:
* my issue has the issue-key DEMOPROJ-1
* Attach the file "DEMOPROJ1-Screenshot.jpg" on the issue
* then edit the summary or create a comment with *\!DEMOPROJ1-Screenshot.jpg\!*-Syntax
* the picture was not embeded and the following error-message was shown: *Unable to render embedded object: File (-DEMOPROJ1--Screenshot.jpg) not found.*

* when the filename *not* contains the issue-key, the embeded-function working fine.
fields.summary: Embeded pictures doesn't show when the filename contain the issue-key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32854].
  {panel}

Hi Team,

Is it possible to create a project workspace in JIRA which can be accessed  through one IP address only.

If the user tries to access through same network but different IP address, than he is not able to access the workspace.

If this is not possible in the On-Demand version than is it possible on downloaded verison of JIRA.

Regards,
Nikhil
fields.summary: Access Project workspace through one IP address

There is no possibility to get back from Configure Screen. In other screens it is implemented by a link. I would expect something like "View all screens".

Screenshot:

fields.summary: No way back from Configure Screen

fields.description:
When trying to add a new group through the JIRA UI, and permanent profiling is activated (via the *web.xml* file and [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+and+Profiling#LoggingandProfiling-Permanentlyenablingprofiling]), the following stack trace is shown in the browser:
{noformat}
java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException
	at sun.proxy.$Proxy1570.findByName(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.AbstractInternalDirectory.findGroupByName(AbstractInternalDirectory.java:576)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.AbstractInternalDirectory.findGroupByName(AbstractInternalDirectory.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.findGroupByName(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:492)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric.findGroupByName(ApplicationServiceGeneric.java:658)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.getGroup(CrowdServiceImpl.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.DelegatingCrowdService.getGroup(DelegatingCrowdService.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.getGroup(FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.java:86)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.user.GroupBrowser.addNewGroup(GroupBrowser.java:114)
...
Caused by: java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.GroupedMethodProfiler.profiledInvoke(GroupedMethodProfiler.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.TimerInvocationHandler.invoke(GroupedMethodProfiler.java:99)
	... 175 more
Caused by: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.GroupNotFoundException: Group <THE-GROUP-NAME-HERE> does not exist
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizGroupDao.findByName(OfBizGroupDao.java:85)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizGroupDao.findByName(OfBizGroupDao.java:42)
	... 181 more
{noformat}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Install a fresh new JIRA 5.2.11 instance.
# Activate permanent profiling as per [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+and+Profiling#LoggingandProfiling-Permanentlyenablingprofiling].
# Try to add a new group via *Administration > Users > Groups*.
# Observe that the stack trace is thrown, and the group is not successfully created.

*Workaround:*
# Disable permanent profiling.
fields.summary: Cannot create groups when Permanent Profiling is activated
